    • Transactional microcopy

    Transactional microcopy

    Microcopy includes the questions and common text you may use throughout a service.

    Guidance

    Don’t use:

    • ‘please’ on labels - give polite, clear, short instruction
    • colons after labels
    • Don’t add ‘your’ to labels etc, for example: your name, your address etc, use ‘name’, ‘address’, unless you have a page with multiple people where you need to differentiate - for example: ‘your name’, ‘partner name’ etc

      • Use:

    • sentence case
    • address the user directly
    • the cap convention in the style guide [link]

      • Style:

    • first name – not Christian name
    • last name – not family name
    • middle name(s)
    • age
    • date of birth - in full, not DOB
      • ###Help text

      There are 3 levels of text:

      On-page help

      One line under the label that will help the user to fill in that field.

      Examples: ‘If you don't have your form XYZ rsquo; or ‘Where to find your Unique Tax Reference Number.’ Show/hide

      Use an expandable show/hide box for slightly more lengthy instructions. You can use statements and questions but don't use the first person.

      Examples: ‘If you want to apply for both of these benefits’ (in this instance, you can’t and there is another process you have to go through. Light box

      Only use a light box for help if you are explaining a concept or part of a process - don't use it for explaining any part of the service. If you need to explain how the service works with that much text, your design is probably wrong.

      ###Radio buttons

      Use: Yes [button] No [button] (note caps)

      Keep to the same convention (yes first) on the page.
